column5: Hey all,  I was flipping around the channels today and came across a great show. Its relatively new, called Monster Fish. The host is a marine biologist that specializes in the largest fish in the world.  Anyway, he goes around the world studying the largest freshwater fish in the world. The episode the I watched, the host was in Mongolia studying the timan (sp?) The world's largest trout.  It was kind of cool, y'all should check it out  Dave
Oh yeah...timans grow to 2m long and 90 kgs....  The babies they were finding are 49" and around 10 lbs
Yeah ive watched it, ive seen a few, but not the Taiman. .....that would be one i'd want to see
Most of them are on youtube.
Just found 'em on You Tube!!!  So who's coming to Mongolia ,Siberia???    RFS
Wow that Salmon is a monster!

Was the host named Zeb Hogan?...Sounds very similar to the show Mega-fish (or something along those lines).  Here's Zeb with a 'baby' taimen   Been compiling a list of monster freshwater fish I wanna catch at least once in my lifetime since I was a kid: Sturgeon, taimen, mahseer, arapaima, giant amazonian catfish, etc...I'm sure after I catch a Taimen, I probably wouldn't look at steelhead the same again
That thing looks sweet!  Do you need like a pool cue for a rod or what?
Strangely looks like a Moray Eel crossed with an Atlantic
Actually no you don't, my dad use to catch them even on a fly with a fly rod.  A fish that is on my must cacth list.  FLEX
i'd love to see a float drop for one of these bad boys.
Theres a movie...Fish Bums: Mongolia...chronicles the search for Taimen on the fly....pretty wild.
